description: Grade 5 Coding - Advanced Scratch & Introduction to Python

project_templates.tagline: Create functions that take inputs and return values!

phase_1_rule_teaching.intro_hook: What if your 'jump' block could jump ANY height you tell it? Functions with INPUTS can do that!

teaching_script.gigi_says: Functions with INPUTS are like fill-in-the-blank. 'Jump (height)' - you fill in the height!
teaching_script.voice_text: Same function, different inputs! Jump 50 for small, jump 100 for big! Flexible!

rule_card.title: Functions with Inputs
rule_card.rule: Add inputs to your function definition. Use them inside. Call with different values!

challenges.prompt: Create a jump block that takes height as input
Create drawSquare (size) that draws any size square

phase_6_complete.celebration: Your functions are smart and flexible! Pro-level coding!

project_templates.tagline: Track the top 5 scores using lists!
project_templates.what_kids_build: A game with a working leaderboard
project_templates.why_exciting: Real games have high scores - now theirs will too

phase_1_rule_teaching.intro_hook: Real games track the TOP 5 scores! We need a LIST to hold multiple values!

teaching_script.gigi_says: A LIST holds many items! Like a numbered list: #1 score, #2 score, #3 score...
teaching_script.voice_text: A list holds many values with numbers! Item 1, item 2, item 3... Add, remove, check!

rule_card.title: Lists
rule_card.rule: A list holds multiple items. Add items, delete items, check items by position!

challenges.prompt: When game ends, add the player's score to high_scores list

phase_6_complete.celebration: Your game has a real leaderboard! Lists are powerful!

project_templates.tagline: Build a story game using text operations!
project_templates.what_kids_build: A text-based adventure with name insertion

phase_1_rule_teaching.intro_hook: Let's make a story where YOUR name appears in the adventure! We'll use STRING operations!

teaching_script.gigi_says: STRINGS are text. We can JOIN them, get their LENGTH, or find LETTERS inside!
teaching_script.voice_text: Join sticks text together. Length counts letters. Letter gets one character!

challenges.prompt: Ask name, then say 'Welcome to the adventure, [name]!'
Get the first letter of their name for a secret code

phase_6_complete.celebration: Your text adventure is personalized! String master!

project_templates.tagline: Build the classic Pong with coordinates and physics!
project_templates.what_kids_build: A working Pong game with bouncing ball
project_templates.why_exciting: Making a REAL classic arcade game

phase_1_rule_teaching.intro_hook: Let's build PONG! The ball moves with x and y speed, bounces off walls and paddles!

teaching_script.gigi_says: X and Y SPEED variables control movement. Change direction by making speed negative!
teaching_script.voice_text: X speed moves side to side. Y speed moves up and down. Multiply by -1 to reverse!

challenges.prompt: Make ball move using xSpeed and ySpeed variables
When touching top or bottom edge, reverse ySpeed

phase_6_complete.celebration: Your Pong game works! You understand game physics!

project_templates.tagline: Your first steps into text-based coding!
project_templates.what_kids_build: Simple Python programs with print and input

phase_1_rule_teaching.intro_hook: You've mastered Scratch! Now let's try PYTHON - the language real programmers use!

teaching_script.gigi_says: Python uses TEXT instead of blocks. print() shows text. input() asks questions!

data.code:
print('Hello World!')
name = input('What is your name? ')
print('Hello ' + name + '!')
data.output:
Hello World!
What is your name? Emma
Hello Emma!

teaching_script.voice_text: Print shows text on screen. Input asks a question and saves the answer. Plus joins text!

rule_card.title: Python Basics
rule_card.rule: print() displays text. input() gets user response. Variables store data. + joins strings.

challenges.prompt: Write Python code to print 'Hello World!'
Ask for their name, then print a greeting with it
challenges.answer:
name = input('What is your name? ')
print('Hello ' + name + '!')

challenges.prompt: Ask favorite color, then say 'I like [color] too!'
challenges.answer:
color = input('Favorite color? ')
print('I like ' + color + ' too!')

phase_6_complete.celebration: You wrote REAL Python code! Welcome to text-based programming!

summary.theme_consistency: Advanced games and transition to text coding for 10-year-olds
summary.transition_note: Grade 5 bridges Scratch and Python - students start learning text-based coding
